page.title: 07BERRINGTON CHURCH
page.content: {The Parish Church,}part of{Hereford {Diocese,}with its{Saxon Font}and oak effigy of{Ould Scriven}is built of red sandstone and with fossil tiles on the tower roof. The weathercock fell down in a storm last year. Pigeons are creating problems messing on the tower and the sandstone is flaking in parts. The{churchyard}is in 2 sections. The N. part of the old churchyard has been cleared of all its illegible stones and the new churchyard is almost full. Part of this churchyard is being made as a{Garden of Rest}for the remains of cremated ashes. A{chalice and patten valued at Â£5000 is in the Treasury at Hereford. A Quota payment of Â£2500p.a. to the Diocese as well as the running and maintenance{costs}of the Church has put pressure on the P.C.C. and the low number of church attenders to find the necessary income.
